title.narrative: Enhanced Adaptation for Smallholder Agriculture Programme – ASAP+ (IFAD)

description.narrative: The ASAP+ activities will contribute to achieving Outcome 2 of the CCDMP, strengthened climate smart agriculture and natural resource management and governance in crisis-affected and at-risk areas and communities. ASAP+ focusses on addressing the climate change drivers of growing food insecurity by providing grant-based financing. The programme is one of three pillars under IFAD’s Rural Resilience Programme (2RP) programme and is integrated into the overall 2RP Theory of Change (see Diagram 1 below). ASAP+ funding will be tied to underlying IFAD projects, with IFAD core financing, although in certain circumstances, stand-alone projects could be financed. The main driving force of ASAP+ is to bring climate financing to agricultural development projects. This is expected to influence and integrate climate concerns to consolidate and increase project impacts and sustainability. While there are various activities that would allow this, ASAP+ will focus on multi-benefit, community-driven approaches to effect change. This will include investments in climate services, natural resources management and governance, women’s empowerment, nature-based solutions, and carbon-sequestration.
